title: Lamb Korma

ingredients.content: 10 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1 tsp fine sea salt, plus extra to taste
1000 g lamb shoulder meat, boneless, cubed (3-4 cm)
150 g plain yoghurt, plus extra for serving

preparations.content: Place 80 g onions, ginger, garlic, coriander, cumin, cardamom, chilli flakes and salt in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer marinade to a large bowl.
Place bowl with marinade on mixing bowl lid and weigh in lamb. Stir well then cover with cling film and place in fridge to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
After this time, place remaining 80 g onions and ghee in mixing bowl then chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add marinated lamb and, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>7 min/120°C//speed 0.5<b>.
Add garam masala, tomato purée and yoghurt then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>99 min/90°C//speed <b>.
Adjust seasoning to taste then transfer to serving bowls. Top with extra yoghurt and coriander leaves before serving with cooked rice.

hintsAndTricks: There are so many wonderful flavours associated with Indian cooking, and this mild korma is a great choice when cooking for a family. Slowly simmering the lamb in a creamy and slightly sweet sauce results in beautifully tender meat. Serve with rice, naan breads and your favourite Indian accompaniments.
